content: no/low sew beer mugs by jessica brewer fb & ig @makingthingsknotty email makingthingsknotty@gmail com intro thank you so much for choosing to make my no/low sew beer mugs i had a brewery market coming up and wanted a quick beer pattern so here we are this is a beginner friendly pattern both mugs are worked from bottom to top changing colors along the way the mini mug is completely no sew other than the face embroidery and tacking down the drips the mega mug is low sew because we ll need to attach the handle the mini measures about 3x4 inches and the mega 7x9 inches if you re using the recommended supplies however these work up well in any yarn weight just be sure to select a matching hook size i hope you enjoy making your beer mugs supplies yarn 3 colors 1 skein each of bernat blanket yarn mug color seagull gray a beer color burnt mustard b foam color white c black acrylic to embroider the mouth 6 5 mm hook safety eyes - 16 mm for the mini 30 mm for the mega blunt tipped needle for sewing poly-fil optional running stitch marker 18 gauge wire for mega mug handle copyright & sellers disclosure all written instructions and photos included in this document are the intellectual property of jessica brewer and may not be copied shared modified sold or reproduced in any way pattern purchase grants the right to sell or gift any products made using this pattern as long as credit is given to the designer when posting on social or in shop listings 2 abbreviations/stitch definitions magic_ring magic_ring single_crochet single_crochet increase increase - work 2 single_crochet in one stitch decrease* invisible decrease - single_crochet next 2 stitches together by working through the flo *when working through the blo make a regular decrease blo back loop only flo front loop only chain/chs chain/chains slip_stitch slip_stitch double_crochet double_crochet st/sts stitch/stitches repeat these sts the number of times indicated number of sts in that round/row fo finish/fasten_off color changes you can use any method you like to change colors i use the technique where you change colors on your second pull through of your last stitch of the round 3 mini mug start with color a stuff as you go but not too firmly- we want to try and keep a flat bottom & top when you change colors fasten_off the previous color as we won t use it again **when you blo slip_stitch keep your gauge loose we don t want to cinch in the sides ** r1 single_crochet 8 in magic_ring close ring 8 switch back to working through both loops r2 increase x 8 16 r7-11 5 rounds of single_crochet 20 20 r3 single_crochet increase x 8 24 change to color c r4 blo- single_crochet 24 change to color b 24 r12 blo- slip_stitch 20 20 r5 blo- slip_stitch 24 24 r13 blo- single_crochet 20 20 r6 blo- single_crochet 2 decrease single_crochet 2 x
